Reviews.Title: “Great overnight Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greytravellerSydney
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel as a stopover close to the cruise terminal for an overnight stay. Arrived at 10 :30pm no issues with booking in with our pre paid deposit. Young couple on the front desk made everything easy. Was given a non smoking room on the 9th floor. Room was clean and well maintained. Bedding sheets etc excellent. Shower and tolit was also clean and tidy although no body wash etc to use in shower but did have a dispenser on the wash basin that could be used as body wash. Tea and coffee making facilities were provided but the coffee provided was a combined coffee/sugar and milk powder. with no alternative provided. Our room was on the front and the main road is out the front. Didn't stop us sleeping after the 8hr trip from Australia but would suggest that if possible you ash for a rear or side facing room. Unfortunately I cannot comment on Breakfast as it is not provided on Sunday Morning the day we left. As a budget hotel for an overnight stay going on a cruise ($5:00 ride to cruise terminal) I would recomend it to others. but as the distance is a way from the airport it is probably not where you would want to stay if you arrived one night and flew out the next day. All in all for us a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small standard room”
Reviews.Author: Z S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right beside a well-served road, with lots of trees. Good neighbourhood. We actually got a good (small) room with two open, sunny windows, but had to move as it was very noisy (facing the road). Provided outdoor-style breakfast; provided tea/coffe-making facility; friendly receptionist; clean public & room areas. Close to Vivo city (short monorail ride to Sentosa Island/Universal Studio Singapore). Shopping Tip: Short bus ride to Vivocity (only 2 stops, costing S$ 1/person). Good shopping center, with Giant, Toys-R-Us, view of the Sentosa Island too.

Reviews.Title: “clean, minimalist, convenient”
Reviews.Author: k58408
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at your hotel. I like the minimalist black and white interior of your rooms and the view outside. I also enjoyed breakfast and thankfully your hotel was located beside a bus stop for convenience. The local and Filipino staff were also friendly and attentive to our needs and requests as guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off”
Reviews.Author: kimaks
Reviews.Content: Not what u think it is...room too small,constructions next to it and service was poor(unfriendly)

Reviews.Title: “Best place for those who are on-the-go”
Reviews.Author: BerniceManila
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from December 21-24 (4 days and 3 nights). We got a standard room with a queen-sized bed and simple amenities. Our stay included complementary breakfast which was served in a covered open-area at the back of the hotel. The staff was nice enough to explain that the hotel was undergoing reservations, thus the location of the meal. Meals were decent with continental choices. However, breakfast food was limited to cereals, milk, tea, coffee, something fried, and something steamed. By the fourth day, we were a bit tired of what we were eating. Since the hotel is quite far from the tube and the crowd, it's quite difficult to get to the hawker areas. Plus side to this though is you are away from the noise and the crowd, best of all, you are located closer to Sentosa. The best way to get around from the hotel is to take the bus which is just a short walk away. This is how we got to Sentosa, Jurong Bird Park (bus then tube), and the Chinese Gardens (bus then tube). I would recommend staying here if you plan to explore the city and spend little time in your room. You get really decent amenities, good service, and decent breakfast from this hotel without sacrificing your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but location is a big problem”
Reviews.Author: liletparedes
Reviews.Content: STAFF We stayed at this hotel just recently and I'd say I would rate it very good in terms of service. The staff were very helpful in almost anything that we need. They are very friendly and accommodating. (especially those front desk officers at night). You call them, and they'll respond in no time. EXCELLENT FOR BUDGET TRAVELLERS We booked two rooms and the price is cheap, but the quality and ambience are much more than what you pay for. Especially in Singapore, where hotel rates are very high. LOCATION The downside of this hotel probably is its location. If you want to shop, see the city, stroll along, or at least eat,you would always need to ride a cab which costs around 7 dollars during the day, and around 14 dollars at night. And for a family of 6, we always needed to hire two cabs, so whatever we saved from booking at this hotel were staved off because of the cost of transportation. You could go by bus, though, It'll be much cheaper - 1.10 dollars. But, if you're not patient to wait, and you're not so sure what bus stop you're stopping to, taking a bus ride is a BIG NO! Whereas, if you book a hotel near Orchard Road -- everything is almost accessible. or even if you need to take a cab, it wouldn't cost you that much. BEST PART! I love the breakfast! (no pun intended) The menu is since time immemorial. =) hehe It comes with unlimited beans, hotdogs, chicken nuggets, baked potatoes, loaf of bread, butter, peanut butter, spreads, cereals, milk, coffee. You would be served exactly the same menu everyday. I'm sure the lady preparing the breakfast can already cook those food even with eyes closed and hands tied. My siblings and I really the unlimited servings of baked potatoes and chicken nuggets. But my dad and aunt said that after five days of stay, they felt nausea at the sight of beans and chicken nuggets. IF YOU LOVE Chicken nuggets, this is definitely the place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Bad quality for high price!!”
Reviews.Author: CelineKay
Reviews.Content: We were staying in the "renovated" room. Negatives: The room was VERY small (might be ok for 1 person or just few nights) There was a machine beeping constantly in the corridor The towels were clean but full of marks, also marks on the bedsheets Not an ideal hotel for a couple The area is not the greatest Too expensive for what it is!!!! For a few more $ per night we moved into another hostel, by far better!!!!! Positives The wifi was working asap Good TV Generally the room was clean Staff was friendly

Reviews.Title: “Clean and economical”
Reviews.Author: Muzz2010
Reviews.Content: I was booked by an agent at another near Buigis.....and it was a dive compared to Harbour Ville. I spent a total of two weeks here and the Staff are very good, Reception Staff are very helpful with information and my room was always well kept. Harbour Ville also have a good supply of Singapore maps available for guests. I enjoyed the bus Service into the city operating very frequently & Cheap & late at night. You can use a bus pass on train travel too. These are purchased at the underground railway info office.....very cheap.

Reviews.Title: “A small, yet good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KOLPKD
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but cosy and comfortable. They are clean and well made up. You can view the St. teresa Church. Being near to harbour front it gives you a good choice for shopping and eating out at the VIVO city. The room charges are nomical and the staff was very cooperative, and took good care of my baby who was just nine months.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, Dont Go!”
Reviews.Author: Tim111984
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel by a colleague not knowing what i would be in for! DO NOT GO! IT WAS UNCLEAN, RUN DOWN, EXPENSIVE AND JUST TERRIBLE. CHECKIN: Fast and efficient ROOM: * Other persons hairs all over the shower. * Shower and toilet were still wet * Mirror moldy * Pool of water inside the fridge and more hairs * Air conditioners filter had never been cleaned and stank * Curtains moldy * Noisy (windows didnt shut properly) * Closet smelt terrible, couldnt use * Kettle filthy, count use * No internet except for the lobby BREAKFAST: Low end of average. I had better breakfasts at a school camp. I have absolutely nothing good to say about this place. Im uploading photos and hope this company goes out of business.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Room and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: traversata
Reviews.Content: I booked a room thru their hotel's website. I was charged a reservation fee of 10% of the total fee. There is no hidden charges, you are billed for what you see on their website. I emailed them to request for an early check-in and I received a prompt reply from their staff. On the day itself, I presented myself to the reception staff and informed her that I have an early check-in arrangement, paid the remaining balance and was immediately given the key to room 805. Inside, the room is quite small compared to hotels (even motorist hotels) in my country. There is just enough space between the door and the edge of the bed so one can open the door. The bed, linen and pillows are okay. The room is provided with the ff: 1. TV (can't find the remote) 2. Aircon 3. Electric kettle 4. Personal fridge 5. 2 Towels (inside the bathroom) 6. 2 rolls of toilet paper 7. 1 trashcan in the bedroom and 1 in the bathroom Along the side table, you'll find 1 bottle of mineral water, 2 sets of cups/saucers, 2 sachets each of sugar and coffee and 1 bag of Lipton Tea. There is no shampoo, soap, toothpaste and toothbrush in the bathroom. The toilet is working properly and the shower/water pressure is okay. The bedroom and bathroom are clean and do not smell musty or foul. Overall, the room is quite basic but the staff are quite helpful, especially Stephanie. I had a problem with my personal mobile so my husband wasn't able to contact me. Stephanie was quick to take action and dispatched a maintenance personnel to check the phone inside the room. Requests for wake-up call and booking of cab where likewise easily accomplished by her. There is construction on-going in the hotel but the noise is muffled inside the room. It is not as noisy as I expected it to be. The other "noise" which I welcome is the ringing of the bells of the nearby church. You won't need to check your watch as the bell is rung the number of times equivalent to the hour. The location is quite near VIVO City and Sentosa. I haven't used the bus but it is only around S$3-4 by taxi to Vivo City and about S$20 to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Fan_Theng
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel back in August in 2010. This hotel ain't that bad. The room is small but enough for two person to sleep in. Bedsheets and towels are changed everyday. The hotel is clean and quiet. Environment is good, just besides the magnificent St. Teresa Church with nice architecture. There is a bus stop nearby that can take you to either Sentosa or Outram Park MRT Station. Great for those who prefer relaxing and less bustling environment. The only down side of this hotel is there is no nearby restaurants, 7 eleven or shopping centre. The nearest Shopping is Vivo City in which you need to take bus to access to there within 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel”
Reviews.Author: qqtraveler
Reviews.Content: A local family operated hotel with over 100 rooms, within a single building near Canadian Int'l School and in between Harbour Front MRT and Outram Park MRT, with frequent public buses (No. 61, 124,143, 166) linking to common tourist area and MRT. You may also get on buses near St. Andrew's Church in City Hall MRT to reach the Hotel. Surrounding area is decent, church bell rings every hour but not disturbing. Wifi is available in public area, so lots of hotel guests sitting near lobby and reception all through the day. The room size is average, furniture and fixings are old but clean. Bedsheet as sleeping blanket, so the air con temperature should not be too low while sleeping, or will get cold at late night. Breakfast is simple and home style... If you look for a place which is safe and clean, and not too expensive in Singapore standard, this hotel may be one of your choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: susyarcy
Reviews.Content: After doing my research for days, I decided to pick this place. I was almost tempted to pick other hotels/hostels (especially Hotel 81), which were a bit cheaper but located in the red light district. This hotel ended up being the perfect choice. It's a bit farther away compared to the other options, but Singapore is small and the transportation works perfectly. The room we got was basic but very clean and with everything in it. It had a window, both in the room and the bathroom and everything worked perfectly. There's also free wifi in the lobby. No breakfast, but that wasn't a big deal for us. I think that you could buy water, sodas, beer and stuff to eat in the lobby too. Anyways, I would stay there again and I strongly recommend it to anyone !

Reviews.Title: “easy access to singapore city and sights”
Reviews.Author: cjtuthill
Reviews.Content: we stayed here two nights, rooms nothing flash, though easily accessible to singapores fantastic public transport to take you where ever you want to go. good excuse to stay out and about!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Value, no frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: bass141
Reviews.Content: Generally no complains about my stay there. Stayed there with my partner, hotel is near to sentosa and chinatown. Bus services easily accessible to town right in front of hotel. There are some convenient shops 5 mins by foot. Room was made up daily, tho it wasnt too big, but it serve us well. We are not there to stay in the room and recept we encountered were all accomodating and helpful. For what I paid, Im happy!

Reviews.Title: “SOMEBODY STOLE MONEY FROM MY ROOM”
Reviews.Author: matthijswiggers
Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel! I had room 805 on the night of Saturday 4 Dec. to Sunday 5 Dec. to join the Singapore Marathon. While I participated in the Half Marathon somebody must have come to my room and searched all my belongings, STEALING 250 Sing.Dollar! Upon my complaint at the reception, the staff only said nobody entered my room... DO NOT GO HERE!

Reviews.Title: “OK value, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: McFjodor
Reviews.Content: Cheap, but not so great location (quiet, but not really close to anything), but fortunately taxis are cheap in Singapore and you'll find one by waiting a minute or two outside of the hotel. Fastest check-in ever (I held the key within 10-20 seconds), and the room was relatively big (by Singapore standards...) after I paid $5 extra for a superior room. The pillow smelled a bit musty, the room could have been cleaner, but overall OK.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you're visiting sentosa island”
Reviews.Author: dajus
Reviews.Content: (+) super location if you want to only visit Universal, Sentosa & Vivocity. 2 min. walk to bus stop-3 buses go to Vivocity (3 min. ride @ $1 per adult). Monorail to Sentosa is in Vivocity and cost $3 for a return trip. (-) not recommended for anyone who's claustrophobic (-) very basic room with only a thin sheet as a blanket (-) floor didn't seem very clean (-) $145 per night for a superior twin room (super basic with no comfort) is costly. Top up another $30 and you'll get more comfort at Grand Mercure which we stayed at the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nico20010
Reviews.Content: Very good Quality/Price Room clean everyday, included TV,coffee, water... Breakfast included Nice and helpfull Staff Sentosa, Chinatown and Clark Quay within 15 minutes by taxi Bus Station 2 minutes by walk Shopping Center 5 minutes by bus MRT Station 5 minutes by bus

Reviews.Title: “Plain and Simple”
Reviews.Author: SeanArcher21
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days with my wife and daughter. (P - positive, N - negative) Room/Hotel: 1. P: Although small, room is clean. Bathroom is clean. 2. N: Hallway in the 9th floor has awful smell. It was like a baby diaper was left in the trash for two days. 3. N: There was still lipstick marks on the cups. 4. P: Employees are very friendly, specially the Filipino. =) 5. N: I've heard from other customers that internet connector is very slow. 6. N: Few TV channels. I only watch HBO and Discovery. 7. P: Good water supply (hot and cold). Breakfast: 1. P: Breakfast is nice. They serve rice. =) 2. P: Service guy is very friendly. 3. N: Area is not ok when raining. Tent has many holes. Location: 1. N: Far from city. 2. N: No convenience store nearby. Tips: 1. Bring your own international adapter. 2. There is a 7-11 store 20-30 minutes away. I suggest buy your things in Vivo City. I will recommend this if you just need a place to sleep and have breakfast in the morning. If you intend to stay here the whole day, then this is not a good place for you. All in all, this is still a nice place for me.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing works quite like it should”
Reviews.Author: lmg25
Reviews.Content: This hotel commits mild fraud in its online advertising. The Harbour Ville claims to be a short walk to the MRT (Singapore's rail-based mass transit system), but it can take as long as 20 minutes to reach the nearest station by foot, and if you plan on making this trip, I hope you're fit, because the island's heat and humidity can make this treck into a mild workout. The hotel claims to have a fitness center, but this consists of a single aging treadmill and an out of date multi-plex weight machine that looks a bit unsafe. The hotel claims to have wireless internet access, but it is available only in the lobby, and is often unavailable there, because the hotel uses an unreliable service provider. Expect internet blackouts. Indeed, the service seems to be off more than it's on. Unless you have business at the harbour complex, the hotel's location is far less than ideal. It is difficult to get downtown, unless you use taxis, which become expesive in short order. There are no nearby eateries. The staff is less than helpful--expect to carry your own bag, and don't count on wake-up calls to be on time. The rooms, while clean and airconditioned, are exceptionally small. If two people were in one at the same time, there would be no room to move. In short, this hotel is not well suited to the business traveler, and given it's distance from Singapore's attractions, I doubt that it suits tourists much better. Consider the Harbour Ville as a back-up hotel, to be used only when more sumptuous options are unavailable.

Reviews.Title: “A Single Night Stay Only - Nothing More Than That”
Reviews.Author: RituIndia_NewDelhi
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very small. Though everything that a traveller would require was provided but there was hardly any space to move around. And we had to be careful during our movements as there were chances of getting hurt against the table corner or the stool. There was LCD TV, wardrobe, a small fridge, mirror, stool, complimentary tea/coffee facility and 1 water bottle was given each day. The bathroom was spacious but the WC was placed in such a manner in one corner that I had difficulty to position my left leg. Toiletries like shampoo, soap and shower gel are not provided in bottled form but are kept in the dispensers in the bathroom. The AC stopped working on the second day evening and it took quite long to get fixed. Though breakfast in included in the rack rate, this hotel never serves breakfast on Sundays. On Saturday morning we found one man single handedly managing the breakfast section. Firstly, we had to wait for the plates to get washed. After we got the plates, we found that breads, eggs, sausages were all gone. Tea and coffee pots were empty too. The man had to refill everything on one hand and do the dishwashing and table cleaning on the other. Thus, the solo man show was very slow! To conclude, choose to stay here for a single night if - * you have plans to visit the Universal Studios, Sentosa Island and China Town. * you have a tight budget Rest of the places like Jurong Bird Park, Night Safari, Singapore Zoo, Singapore Flyer, Clark Quay or Hippo Tours are far off from this place and you need to change bus and trains to reach there. The Night Safari bus will not drop you to this hotel but they have other hotels as their drop points. However, there are buses to take you to the city center and airport is 20 minutes taxi ride.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't a nightmare, but wouldn't go back!”
Reviews.Author: Linner44
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a last-minute booking! We stayed one night. The rooms are incredibly small and not overly clean. The only blanket is kept in a closet that smells like it used to house a dead body. I had to drink a few Singapore Slings before I could pass out in the bed... but this is all relative, right? My family either stayed in nicer hotels, or we stayed at home! We weren't wealthy but we never went the budget way, so I'm just not used to seeing a hotel like this. I think, for many, this place would be absolutely fine. The staff are incredibly friendly, and willing to help you get anywhere on the bus! The lobby is deceiving: renovated much more recently than the rooms! If you're looking for a cheap place to stay and don't mind a few small bugs crawling on your pillow (don't worry; they aren't bedbugs), then this is the place for you. If you'd rather spend a few extra dollars and not have to get buzzed up before you pass out, then check out the Fragrance Hotel Viva. We stayed there the next night, and I was a much happier princess.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and efficient hotel but lacking in atmosphere and vibe”
Reviews.Author: Lavy81
Reviews.Content: I suppose this hotel would be the typical Singaporean hotel. We reserved a standard queen room and it was really compact. You swing open the door and theres the bed, right in front of you. However, it has everything you would need - ensuite bathroom, shower, coffee maker, air conditioning and a flat screen TV nailed to the wall. Its not spacious but what would you expect in Singapore? I paid SGD95 for the location close to Sentosa as I was attending a concert there. I suppose overall it was okay...its definitely the cheapest accomodation to get to Sentosa and has everything you actually need (aside from space). It even has a gym! Note though, hotel does not serve breakfast on Sundays (only Sundays for some strange reason).

Reviews.Title: “Quite good”
Reviews.Author: CadenStor
Reviews.Content: One thing i enjoyed the most was the cleaniness. our room was quite clean anc comfortable. However, the location is quite far from the downtown. although the buses were available to get there easily. The prices was reasonable, therefore, if travelling on a budget, this would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and clean budget hotel with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Osaka_Slim
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel specifically to be near the Bukit Merah Central area for a convention there and away from entertainment areas, so the location was perfect for me. Post-convention it was easy to catch a taxi from in front of the hotel and not too expensive to get to Orchard. The frequent buses were easy to use and ridiculously cheap. The hotel staff can arrange for a shared minibus taxi to the airport for just SDG9 (pay driver). I found my room to be quite reasonably sized and having stayed low-budget in London and Japan, on the large side in comparison! It was clean when I arrived and well serviced daily. The breakfast is traditional English and I found it fantastic. Buffet-style help-yourself sausages, chicken nuggets, omelet, baked beans and toast. Fried noodles, too. Lots of it (anyone complaining of amount needs to take a careful look at their diet!), and continuously replenished from 7:30 to close to 10 a.m. by a very hard working cook. The alfresco location was a quiet and pleasant place to start the day, too. Front desk staff were available 24/7 and very helpful with all enquiries. (Sometimes mid-morning the one person on duty can get inundated with telephone calls so you may have to be patient for a few minutes.) Wi-fi is free in reception and there are three PCs available for SGD1 for 15 min. in a secluded room. I'm glad I chose this hotel, and I shall be staying here again next year! This is a very nice budget hotel; anyone who wants 3-star accommodation in a prime location are free to go elsewhere and pay at least 30% more for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: LSydney
Reviews.Content: Had 2 rooms for 2 nights during a stopover on the way to Europe: rooms are small but clean. Aircondition in both rooms worked perfectly. Very friendly staff who allowed us to use the showers in the fitness room on the evening of our departure (had an overnight flight). Breakfast is ok - and we enjoyed the outside terrace where the breakfast is served. Location of hotel is not close to downtown, but Taxis in Singapore are fairly cheap (varying rates depending on time of day and destination - hotel staff helped us with tips how to save money..)

Reviews.Title: “Very incoveniently located”
Reviews.Author: theyoungindian
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very incoveniently located from the main city. The amenities are okay too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for a cheap price”
Reviews.Author: zilo
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a fairly clean place to sleep for a night, the Harbour Ville Hotel is a good choice. There's nothing fancy about it, and it's definitely not romantic, but the hotel staff is friendly, and the service is okay. The breakfast wasn't spectacular by any means, but it was fairly clean and filling. Our room was pretty small, but compared to Singapore standards, it was a decent size. It was clean, and it had a TV. Unfortunately, our air conditioning stopped working in the middle of the night which made it difficult to get a good night's sleep in the hot and humid weather. The location is a little far from downtown, but it's pretty close to the bus stop. Buses always came within 10 or 15 minutes at most, and they all stop at the subway, which is only about 5 minutes away. Other buses go to Chinatown, which takes only about 15 minutes or so from the bus stop near the hotel. I would recommend this hotel if you're looking for a budget hotel to stay for a short time.

Reviews.Title: “Non-tourist location, great bus service, close to Harbour”
Reviews.Author: JayDonald
Reviews.Content: No convenient train station within walking distance, but bus stops right in front. One direction to tourist shopping area, other direction to Harbour, with two food courts (one open-air and authentic, other air-conditioned and somewhat up itself. Tang's Dept Store at Wharf has same selection as Tang's Orchard Road without the crowds. Breakfast minimal, so we bought local fruits to supplement, no complaint. Were surprised not to get breakfast on Sunday! However a few minutes' walk away is a housing unit with basement food shops. We will be going back to this hotel again, because the low cost comes from its location, not from lack of maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussi2
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel last November for only 1 night. Was a bit worried by some of the bad reviews but didn't want to pay a lot for a stop-over. I found the room to be basic but clean and quite big enough for 2 people. The air-conditioning worked extremely well and as there was not a blanket or quilt on the bed, it got quite cold during the night. Didn't want to turn it off completely so just put my coat over the sheet. The worse thing about it was the location. Even though taxis are cheap in Singapore, it cost to get to the hotel from the airport, into Suntec the next morning and back in the evening to collect bags then another taxi to the airport. In hindsight, I might have been better off to pay a bit extra and stay closer to the city. The breakfast "room" was interesting. It was outside at the back of the hotel and seemed to almost be a barbecue breakfast. However, the food was fine. Of course, standards change a bit with changes in staff but at the time I stayed there, it was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the ambience”
Reviews.Author: rahulonlinedear
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. The ambience is to good.St.Tresa church is just the next to the hotel. Very near to Sentosa. The service is too good and the best part is the food of the hotel.Service is too good.3 cheers to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “dirty bathroom, creepy porter, budget motel”
Reviews.Author: RichDD
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were vacationing in singapore with a friend and we decided on this place since we only planned to stay for 3 days. the only decent part of our stay was the breakfast which was included. it was actually tasty. hopefully it was clean as well. ok, lets skip to the bad. check in was relatively quick. got our keys (not e cards) and a few bits of useful tourist info. when we entered our room, there was a strong odor of urine. we looked around and discovered the source of the odor to be the bathroom. there were urine stains on the bathroom floor as well as droplets of urine on the toilet seat. there was urine in the toilet!! it was obvious that the room and/or bathroom were not clean/sanitized. we called the front desk and a porter came pretty quickly. he sprayed the bathroom and and wiped it down. and he repeated a few times. our friends room was no better. his room wreaked of urine as well but the odor emanated from his closet. the porter tried to wipe down his room /closet as well. all the while, this porter was checking out my wife. the indian dude was creepy. if youre adventurous, are not afraid of germs, and want a budget motel, stay in harbour ville. if you want 3 stars on a budget, try elsewhere .

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Budget”
Reviews.Author: ChrisPirie
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went to Singapore for 10 days. We are in the hotel for 8 nights and it was all we needed. While there are more luxurious hotels, we wanted a bed and a shower. I would like o say to those who are saying bad things about this hotel - its a cheap hotel and if you want something posh you have to pay accordingly. Would not hesitate in recommending for those wanting something basic for a budget getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel within budget”
Reviews.Author: Joydeep_Travelling
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for budget traveller. I was there for 4 nights along with my wife. This hotel has got all facilities what a person may require but within a limited range. Morning Breakfast is the area of improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrinksMP
Reviews.Content: UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES STAY AT THIS HOTEL. IT IS A HEALTH HAZARD!!! My husband and I stopped in Singapore for 3 nights on our way back to Australia from Vietnam. We didn't want anything flash, just somewhere to put our luggage and sleep so after reading the reviews I thought this would be fine. WHAT A MISTAKE. The room was so small we could hardly move around the bed and this was supposed to be a Superiour Queen Room! The shower was over the toilet and water went everywhere when we showered. The air conditioner was so loud we could hardly sleep and it couldn't be adjusted by the control. The room was covered in mould and mildrew and we couldn't open the fridge without gagging from the smell!!!! We stayed one night and had to check out!! Both of us were worried about our health! This made our trip to Singapore very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “small but fairly efficient”
Reviews.Author: luvicPTL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite isolated and you would need a taxi or bus to get anywhere near town. It's fairly efficient with polite reception staff. On the downside, the rooms are small and compact which may spell trouble if you have large cabin cases. Breakfast is al fresco and basic but you get what you pay for. We stayed near the top of the hotel and didn't hear any clanging noises probably from some water tank that some reviewers had written about. Also, no one had knocked at our door asking if we want company in the wee hours (the room is too small for such purposes anyway!) and we didn't see any couples coming in for love activities but maybe we couldn't tell them apart from the other tourists! The hotel is quite far from the airport and you can easily arrange with the efficient reception for the 30 - 45 minutes ride to the airport. All in all, this is a small hotel which is suitable for a short stay of one or two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: ITIK-ITIK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbourville for 4 nights at the end of July at the start of our 4 wks in Singapore & Malaysia.After reading some of the reviews,I was a bit apprehensive but the original hotel we wanted was fully booked & the price was right. We were, therefore, very pleasantly surprised by the great service we received. We arrived 5 hours early for check in due to flight timings & the receptionist went out of her way to have our rooms prepared quickly & did not charge any extra. The rooms were small but spotless as were the bathrooms but more than adequate for the amount of time we actually spent in the room.Also, for the amount we paid, we were not expecting Raffles type luxury but we had no complaints. Breakfast was ok but the guy who worked very hard on his own making it was very obliging. Yes its a bit out of the way but public transport & taxis were readily available & it was close to Vivocity & the Sentosa Express. There is a residential area at the back of the hotel with a couple of small food courts & convenience stores. We did not witness any dodgy activity regarding prostitution whatsoever. All reception staff were very friendly & helpful at all times. We would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Cheap People”
Reviews.Author: McGalio
Reviews.Content: Its definitely not a place you want to spend your days in. The room we stayed in was no larger than the bed, and the toilet was in the shower. VERRRY SMALL! Not that we minded. For the traveller that uses the room basically for sleep, it does the trick. Our room was clean. The room is very cheap for Singapore and is within stricking distance of everything with Singapore's excellent transit service. You can take a short (cheap) bust ride to Outram Park MRT where you can connect to anywhere (again for cheap!) There is air conditioning! But, you only get a sheet to sleep under. This hotel only covers the basic necsesities. If you're fine with that, you can save some big $$$. We paid $59CAD/Night.

Reviews.Title: “What is get is what you paid”
Reviews.Author: chicagogradstudent
Reviews.Content: I am a grad student living in Chicago who came to Singapore to attend a conference in downtown. I stayed here three nights because other hotels in downtown are quite expensive to afford. I am basically satisfied with the experience because the rate-service balance is what I had expected. What I didn't expected is that this hotel is not only for tourists- A friend of mine who lives in Singapore told me that this hotel is also for men and women who need a room just for several hours. There is a price in this hotel for this kind of short stay. It's so called "love hotel". Also, as other people have commented earlier, you would need to have some transportation to get yourself to food courts or shopping or whatever. There is absolutely nothing around the hotel. If you are going to downtown area, it would take extra US$20 per night for commuting if you take taxi, which would be another reason we have to discount the rate that they offer. A taxi driver told me that you can find cheaper hotels in other areas. The thing is, you won't be able to book online; you will have to ask local people. Also, don't book hotels in gaylang area simply because the hotels are cheap unless if you are ok with having prostitutes as your neighbors doing their business. Overall, this is a budget hotel. So if you are looking for better service, search others. In the TripAdvisor ranking I couldn't find other hotels with cheper or same price that delivers more satisfaction ratings. If you do find these, please let evevryone know. Pros 1. reasonable rate for reasonable service 2. taxis are easy to get 3. people at front are ok- at least in my stay 4. cleaning comes everyday Cons 1. Water from shower is not warm enough 2. You have to pay internet for S$3 per hour

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Jonno82
Reviews.Content: We went to Singapore on a family reunion (we live in different countries), it's me and my parents' first trip to Singapore and I have to say the hotel is a little disappointing. We arrived at around 9pm, my uncle booked 3 rooms and he had already checked in. We went to the front desk and asked the girl if the room for us is available, and this is a beauty, she scribbled a room number on a piece of scrap paper and that was it!! When we asked if my uncle had already checked in, the girl (or should I say B*$tch?) was simply being rude and talked to us as if we were trying to kill her and raise up her arms and repeatly said "I don't know anything, I just started my shift". So we went up to the room she gave us, no one was there, had to drag all luggage downstairs and talk to her and got the same treatment, she then proceeded to wrote two other room numbers on another piece of scrap paper, by then I was quite annoyed and asked her what exactly was the room number she gave us, she simply banged a telephone on the counter and asked me to call those rooms! While I was trying to call those 3 rooms she gave us, I saw she got those information from her check in folder! I guess it was too difficult for her to tell me "The person made the booking is already here, those are the rooms under his name, please use our internal phone to reach him" When we entered the room there were more disappointment, air con not working, tiny room with barely any space, and there weren't even blankets on the bed! Had to went down and talk to the evil witch again, the maintenance man was nice, although the witch told us off for requesting blankets as "only 1 per room" allowed. Excuse me, didn't know we are not allowed to request basic items that should have been there in the first place. The rest of stay in Singapore was fun, it was very suprising the day shift girls were actually helpful and nice! They were very responsive and extremely friendly. The hotel is not in the CBD, but in Singapore, cab anywhere won't cost you more than 15 - 20 dollars, so if you traveling in groups, make sure you get a taxi. The hotel is very close to Sentosa and taxi only cost about 8 dollars to get there. I guess for the hotel, try not to stay there unless it's MUCH cheaper than anywhere else. We were booked into this hotel because all other CBD hotels were outrageously expensive due to some conference happening in Singapore, even this hotel cost 170+ per night and it was definitely not worth the price you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not recommended”
Reviews.Author: zulfinho
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have just stayed in this hotel for 3 days on my way back to the Netherlands from Bali. All I can say, it is definitely a big disappointment. During my contact with the hotel before our stays, it's always been a helpful and smooth communication though only through email, but during the stays the communication especially with the front desk receptionists had been a struggle. We find the front desk receptionist rude, this is coming from my wife who had lived almost 8 years in Singapore, so it is not merely a culture gap. Furthermore, some facilities that are supposedly available in the room have to be asked before you can get it, e.g. hair dryer and blanket. After closely looked at the available room, we find that we are given the wrong room type. We complained this, but there's nothing we can do, we planned not to stay long at the room anyways. The room is so small. It is so crammed, you cannot put your luggage anywhere but to put in front of the closet, which makes you unable to open it. In our room, the air conditioner initially is unable to be controlled by the remote. After we complained about it a nice man fix it and set the AC to be controllable. Unfortunately, three big leaks near the wall coming from the AC are not fixed until we checked out, even though we already complained this since the day we arrived. Next is the location, there is only two buses that go to the Orchard road, it is also only every 15 - 20 minutes. The nearest MRT station is around 15 - 20 minutes of walk. It is also the case with the nearest shopping center and departure place to Sentosa Island. One plus side is the breakfast. The self-service breakfast was very nice. Having breakfast in patio, although during our stays, it rained once but there's a canopy to protect us. The guy serving the food was very nice and very helpful. All in all, if you have other options besides this, please do stay at other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “not professional”
Reviews.Author: Iban-Torontonian
Reviews.Content: First, did not remember our reservation. Front desk rude. Placed us in a smoking room when we asked for non smoking room. Even non smoking room was smokey. The room is small, but then that's ok right because it's just a place to sleep. But the smoke smell, can't can't can't i repeat, can't breath. shower was good, toilet was bad, had to change roomS. Loud if facing the street side. Internet good. Gym was ok. Breakfast is ok, since it's only ONE older guy cooking for everyone. LOCATION not good, not close to anything. seriously, tho we did use bus. but cost accumulate fast that way. ate meals in chinatown i wouldn't complain about this kind of hotel except that they asked us to pay for a budget hotel as if it's an average cost hotel.

Reviews.Title: “O.K. for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: Ravchek
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in May. The hotel itself is easy enough to get to. Get the MRT to Harbour Front Station and get a cab to the hotel. The room on first inspection appeared to be clean, the bathroom was ok and the normal toiletries are provided. I arrived on a Saturday and I was well informed that breakfast is only offered Mon to Sat. I actually misplaced my passport (somehow) so i had to search for it, During my extensive searchthat lasted for about half an hour, I was greeted by filth under the bed, in corners and under the table. Admittedly it was it has accumulated over a period of time, but for a hotel you would expect it not to be there. Another thing the sheets were old and the remote for the TV didnt work. Anyway, getting to town is easy enough, walk to the front of the hotel and a taxi will eventually come along and pick you up if you so wish or you can take a bus to Chinatown or to Harbourfront, or just take an extended stroll to Harbour Front. Overall, a reasonable priced hotel for Singapore but I doubt I could recommend it to anybody or stay there again

Reviews.Title: “it was ok, but very small and not real convenient”
Reviews.Author: lovestraveling53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Harbour Ville for a total of 5 nights. We stayed the 1st night in a Superior room and then left 2 large luggage bags with the hotel and traveled to Thailand for 4 days. When we returned, we stayed another 4 nights in a regular room. The first night was fine, even though the room was small & crowded, it was clean and at the back of the hotel. The breakfast on the patio was very good and filling. When we returned, our luggage was sitting in the lobby, and had been for the whole 4 days. We were then assigned a regular room on the front of the hotel. It was the tinest room and alot of street noise. The bath wasn't as clean & the A/C leaked all down the wall, causing a puddle in the floor. We were only in the room in the evenings to sleep, thank goodness. I am a light sleeper and had to wear ear plugs because of the traffic noise. These 4 nights were paid for with frequent flyer miles, so I don't know if this was the reason we were given the room we had or what. The staff were exceptionally friendly & helpful though. Another T.A. reader had said there was a 7-11 behind the hotel. We asked directions and found it up behind the bus stop in the middle of some apartments. We also found a bakery that was very good, right across from the 7-11. I had some problems with the internet, but the front desk was always helpful to try and fix it. You have to walk a little ways down the street to a bus stop to catch a bus to get to the MRT station. We bought an E-Z link card, which was good for the MRT & bus. We rode the bus to the Harbour Front MRT Station and then we could take the MRT to where ever we needed to go. When we would come back in the evening, if we wanted to stop and have a quick, cheap meal, we would go to Vivo City Mall and eat in the food court and then catch the bus back to the hotel. You can catch the Harbour Front MRT from the basement of Vivo City Mall. If you plan to stay here, pay a little extra & get the superior room. Both room had the tea kettle and fixings and a small fridge.

Reviews.Title: “A Room is a Room”
Reviews.Author: HonestPolicy
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay as long as you don't plan on being in your room the whole time - the rooms are small but nicely furnished and the bathrooms are clean. The location is ok - close to Sentosa access but a little further from other attractions such as Chinatown and City Centre - but these are very easily reached by the MRT. If you are planning a holiday where you stay in your room - spring for a place with bigger rooms. Great place to spend the night if only have a quick stop over and money is important!

Reviews.Title: “5th time staying over....Still as good”
Reviews.Author: Perfect_Harmony
Reviews.Content: This is my fifth time staying at the hotel. It is clean and we have never experienced good service before. The room is spartan and clean white. Breakfast is a lovely continental spread with ham, hotdogs, baked beans, eggs etc. Worth every penny that I paid for! However, please bear in mind breakfast is not served on Sunday. It is a few bus stops away from Vivocity, largest shopping mall in Singapore, Sentosa and harbour front MRT. Take bus 61, 143 or 166 opposite harbour ville hotel. Overall I would say this is probably a good hotel to stay in with a budget of below S$100!

Reviews.Title: “Good value as a transit hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night on our way back to Perth after a week in Phuket. Good value as a transist hotel. Room very small but didn't smell of smoke. Bathroom small, but clean. You have to be skillful not to spray the toilet with water. Room air conditioned. Nothing in bar fridge, but one bottle of water supplied. For the cost, and the fact we were leaving at 5.00am for our flight home it was more than adequate. A better choice if you can get a booking is IBnb a bed and breakfast, walking distance from this hotel. We walked to the Outram train station from this location. Turn left after leaving the hotel, keep walking to till you reach the T junction, turn right and another 10 minutes you reach the Outram train station. No real complaints, if you want a good price you can't expect top accomodation. One complaint worth noting is that the pillows were very thin. As the rooms are small I would avise going out for tea or something similar and using the room as a spot to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable accomodations”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 days at the Harbour Ville. The rate was substantially lower then most decent hotels in Singapore and the reviews seemed OK. Check in was quick. When I got to the room, it had a smoke odor. I called the front desk who told me they do not have non-smoking rooms, but promptly sent someone up to spray the room and left an air purifier. That took care of the problem. The room was kind of small, as was the bathroom. But it was very clean and comfortable. There is no clock, so better bring your own. I was on the 8th floor and you could hear the traffic in the street. That is not a problem for me, but maybe to someone not used to it. Also there is a church next door that rings it's bell often. The location is not really convientient to anything. It is a 5-10 minute taxi ride to Chinatown. Taxis are cheap and there is a bus that goes there to. There are no facilities nearby. There is a breakfast in the morning except on Sunday, but it is not very good. The guy in charge seemed to have a grudge. To sum it up, if you are looking for inexpensive, clean accomodations, then the Harbor Ville will work for you. If you want to be pampered, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very average: short stay only”
Reviews.Author: peter991
Reviews.Content: Very average place. Arrived at 11pm. Reception glanced at my passport - told me I was staying for 2 night - I had in fact booked and pre-paid for 3 nights. Given room key and told which floor it was on. No mention of facilities available. Bedroom measured 3 metres x 3 metres, bathroom was 1 metre wide x 2 metres long. No spare power-points, no international adapter available (bought one for $SG3 at Sim Lim Square). Room price is $SG105 per night off the street, half of that if you book online through an agency. Hotel is too far to walk to or from anywhere - take a taxi - they are prompt and cheap and drivers very talkative and friendly and speak excellent English. The only bonus is room delivery of meals at night. Do not use inhouse Internet: $SG3 an hour! Peter

Reviews.Title: “Great value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: sibh22
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a beautiful, but expensive town, especially for a budget traveller or backpacker. However the Harbour Ville Hotel, offers good value and is clean and friendly. We paid $40 a night through Asiarooms. It is not luxurious, but doesn't claim to be. Our room, on the 8th floor, had a relatively comfortable bed, tv, fridge and lots of storage space, as well as basic but clean ensuite bathroom. All linens and towels were changed everday and fresh bottles of water are left in the room, along with tea and coffee making facilities. The hotel is about a 15-20 minute walk (turn right from hotel) from the Harbourfront MRT station, which is also where you can find the huge Vivo city mall, and the entrance to Sentosa. Buses are also plentiful, and go from outside the door. The breakfast is not great, but is edible and there is plenty of it. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, as are most people in Singapore. Overall I would give this hotel a thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Value”
Reviews.Author: flown_away
Reviews.Content: The hotel is simple but clean, good for value. The location is a little bit far from MRT Station, a short bus journey, but not too much hassle. The room is bit small, but at least clean and with comportable air conditioning. Staff are friendly and helpful. The only thing which I can't stand is their breakfast, really not healthy and tasty. However, in all, it is a quite a good budget hotel for young travellers to choose.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you are on a budget”
Reviews.Author: pompeii
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we decided to go for it and booked a 10 night stay at the Harbour Ville. For the money we thought it was very good. Because of the earlier reviews we did not expect too much from the breakfasts but did find something we could eat even if its was just toast and jam, the green jam was very interesting. We found local shops in the flats(apartments) at the back of the hotel where food could be bought, there is also a 7-11 store. We had a room at the back of the hotel and apart from some wholesome singing from the church next door it was mostly quiet. There is definitely some sex trade activity though there was never anyone hanging around outside the hotel. All the staff we dealt with were helpful and courteous we did ask for our room to be changed twice, the first one was on the 9th floor we did not look at that one.(We had taken note of problems with noise from Air con plant) Room 2 was on the 6th floor at the front we agreed to stay in it one night because of road noise. Room 3 was at the back, showing its age a bit but very clean, clean sheets, white fluffy towels and cleaned daily. We used the airport shuttle at a cost of S$35 to get from the airport to the hotel, we flagged a taxi down for the return journey this cost S$14.50. We have added this hotel to our list of will do again hotels

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: BillParis
Reviews.Content: If it's a clean, comfortable and inexpensive night's stay you're looking for then this hotel is ideal. A $5 SGD cab fare into the city centre, the hotel is quite central and the reception desk is helpful.I cannot fault it for value.

Reviews.Title: “Really Basic”
Reviews.Author: moodyinsingapore
Reviews.Content: Frankly speaking, this is one of the lousiest hotel i've ever stayed in. However, for the price, I supposed I am not in the position to complain. Everything was so basic, the bed was so hard, the blanket was so thin, and any view from the window was non existance. The only plus points I can think of was the bathroom, which was newly renovate. Moreoever, its in the middle of nowhere and you need to take a bus or a taxi to get to the city or the nearest shopping center, Vivocity. I will not recommend this hotel unless you are really tight on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: udalvr
Reviews.Content: This hotel is worth the price you pay for. I got a deal for 4 nights for US$200. Only problem is the location. Way out of town. Harbourfront MRT is not walking distance or 1 km. There is a bus stop just outside the hotel. You can take busses from there to the MRT. Takes about five minutes. If you want to connect to the net in your room, you need to borrow a modem from the front desk which is chargeable by the hour. They have about four to six modems. So sometimes, you may not get the modem when you need it. Also the coin operated laundry - people don't bother to take thier clothes out of the machine when its done. It's just left in the machine and you got to wait until the owner collects it. Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean and comfortable hotel. Definately worth the price. If I am on a tight budget, I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “For the price difficult to fault.”
Reviews.Author: jimbojetset
Reviews.Content: Ok so the Harbour Ville is never gonna be in the Sheraton/ Le Meridean league but at twenty quid a night what can you expect?! For the price we paid the Harbour ville delivered. We spent 3 nights in a superior room. The room although not particulary large ,was certainly bigger than the room we had just left in HK. The ensuite bathroom was plenty big enough with powerful shower. The room was clean and tidy with enough space to hang clothes, A mini fridge was included as was obligatory A/C. The front desk staff were always friendly and approachable Only gripes: 1) A/C unit way too noisy, looked a little outdated. 2)Location a little out of the way but only £2 taxi fare to centre of town. 3) Lousy breakfast, bearly edible. On the whole enjoyed stay there, and very much doubt if equivalent standard of accomodation can be found at such a low price.

Reviews.Title: “agree with the last review”
Reviews.Author: industry_killer
Reviews.Content: I really liked the hotel, the area was great it was a little ways out of the main city but Chinatown was only 2 mins away by bus one way and a huge mall Vivo City a 10-15 min walk or short bus ride the other way. The rooms were a average to good size, the bed was comfortable and the staff seemed friendly and helpful. We only ate breakfast 2 days we were there. It didn't seem to bad otherwise we tried to eat outside the hotel, try local food. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable experience”
Reviews.Author: Burrd
Reviews.Content: - Limited parking bays. - Fairly quick and simple check-in. - Sale of sandwiched, drinks and cigarettes in lobby. - 2 lifts, each with its own button. So if you're on the ground floor, and Lift A is at ground floor, and Lift B is on the 5th floor, and you press the button for lift B, you have to wait for Lift B to come down. Lift A won't open for you even if its already oin the ground floor. - $3/hr internet access in room, but did not try. - $1 for 15min using their PC, was simple to use. Celeron 1.8 with 256MB. - The gym consists or a treadmill and 2 stationary bikes - Breakfast is included, but i was not informed of it. No coupon is needed or given. - Breakfast was fried rice, sausages, ommelette, hash, tea/coffee. - Breakfast served outdoors, quite pleasant with the trees, but can get a little warm after 10am. - Room was clean. - Shower leaks. - TV remote control does not work, and nobody came to assist even after complaining. - Mini-fridge takes a long time to get even a can of coke cold. Doesn't help that when you remove your key from the holder near the door, ALL power goes off. - Absolutely no shops in the vincinity! You'd have to drive out, or take a bus/taxi. Vivo shopping centre is about 1km away.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: twinD
Reviews.Content: We were hesitant to book here because the hotel isn't really near anything, but hours of searching turned up nothing under S$150 that I would take my family to. So we booked. And the place if fine. We liked: -Very clean. -Friendly and relaxed staff. Not hung up on a bunch of "hotel policies" -Everything in the room worked. -Price (under S$100), hard to find a decent place in this range. We didn't like: -In room internet requires borrowing a modem from the desk, using it, bringing it back and then charged for the time you borrowed it. I'd recommend getting the internet full-time in the rooms. -It is true there's not so much as a convenience store you can walk to, but - there is a bus stop out front and I don't think we ever waited more than two minutes for a taxi. -Small room. -A bit of a musty odor in the room, but the A/C worked well and it went away quick. Would I stay here again? Possibly. If I could find a decent place closer in town at the same or just a little more then I would take it, but failing that I would have no problems returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: cch1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for several days in March, 2007. I booked this hotel on Expedia as it received fair reviews and was quite cheap for Singapore. It is not within convenient walking distance from any of the touristy sites in Singapore, however, is very near a bus stop and is about 5 stops from Chinatown. Also, it gets regular taxi traffic if one prefers that mode of getting around. It is also fairly near the Harbourfront station area. Bus service in Singapore was 90 cents (Singapore) per person/per trip, which is quite cheap and several routes pass by the hotel. We used the bus service to get around while staying at Harbour Ville and they have the numbers of the busses that pass by their hotel on their business cards for your convenience. The rooms are small, but the AC works well and there was adequate hot water. The bathrooms are also small and the toilet areas tend to share real estate with the shower. Each room has a small TV that gets about 4-5 stations incl. a movie channel. Breakfast is served every day except Sunday and includes coffee/tea/juice, fried hot dog, cold baked beans, scrambled egg, toast with jam and peanut butter and possibly fried potato. Staff there were courteous and business-like, but don't expect to be romanced! A cabbie pointed out to us that the hotel has a reputation for some prostitution traffic, however, this wasn't as issue during our stay although we did see a woman who appeared to be on the job at about 1 AM. Certainly, this is at least partially due to the fact that the hotel is across the street from the industrial harbour area where ships load and unload and there are probably some visitors in town in there with some needs for female attention! Again, our rooms were quiet on our two seperate stays here, however. I suspect whatever traffic of that nature the hotel might get is reserved for floors other than where longer term occupants might be staying. I just thought this was important to note. We saw numerous Chinese and Malay tourists staying there while we were there. For our needs, this accommodation was perfectly fine and allowed us to save some money on our overhead while in Singapore. I would recommend Harbour Ville to those on a budget who don't mind taking the bus and having a small room when they travel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Torge
Reviews.Content: Certainly a budget hotel with open air parking for about 8 cars, 2 elevators servicing 13 rooms per floor, about 10 floors. I booked a four day stay with my wife and 2 kids by calling the hotel directly. I did this even if it cost me about US$20/night more than booking through Expedia or the like for 2 reasons: firstly - to verify that there would be no extra charges for 4 of us staying in 1 room (2 twin beds); secondly - to make sure that my reservation was verified and wouldn't get mixed up as some other reviewers claimed. We got our room on the 8th floor. It had 2 twin beds, a TV, a miniref, a small closet with 3 hangers but no dresser / cabinet. The bathroom was as expected, a bit bigger than usual I guess, but there is no shower divider - just a depression in the corner. They do however give you floor towels now, so no need to use a bath towel on the floor. Beware the red light! We accidentally turned off the switch beside the red light when we left the room, which shut off the water heater - it takes about 30 minutes build up a store of hot water again. Also, pulling the key holder from the wall switch shuts off the power to the whole room, including the ref. Good thing the kids milk in the ref didn't go bad while we were away. This is probably a common feature, but it was almost a whoopsy. We henceforth took the key of the holder, left the holder in the wall switch and did our touring with the key on our key ring (keep the Do Not Disturb sign on your door if you do this). The room was a long thin rectangle, not too spacious but everything fit, and we weren't there to enjoy the room. The room was very clean however, and more so the bathroom. The lobby is really small, with chairs to the far left, the front desk to your left, elevators to the right and sandwich display case to the far right. There's a small verandah out back where they serve breakfast - no room service. The hotel staff was courteous, polite, knowledgeable and helpful. For instance, we asked for the room to be cleaned up at 5pm, not the regular cleanup time. They came by in 15 minutes and swept up. On leaving, the lady at the front desk got up, went to the curb and called us a cab. Don't expect any eateries too close to the hotel, but a 10 min. walk takes you to Vivo City / Sentosa Bridge / Harbour Fronte Centre / MRT-NE1 whre you will find more than enough to feed you and your loved ones. In the other direction 10 min. walk along Kampung Bahru, across from the Singapore General Hospital there are a few of the famous food stalls. All in all, a great budget hotel. We'd gladly stay there again - and do without the additional family room / guest charges other hotels may levy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DMMDOMINIQUE
Reviews.Content: Exellent room and bath room very clean and fonctional, frienly effiance staff very good service laundry internet gym ,if you have a car or known the bus service very good location . Small probleme no braekfast on sunday. I stay four nights room allway very clean recomande this hotel very good value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Harbour Ville Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 512 Kampong Bahru Road, Singapore 99448, Singapore
